text: How do algebraic expression and equation help express patterns and relationships between factors and multiples?

Students might discuss that algebraic expressions

  • have variables, which are letters standing for numbers;
  • are ways to write what we say with words; and
  • give us some shortcuts to say something (much like emojis or texting acronyms, such as lol).

Students might give examples, such as 3N is a multiple of 3, it has two factors 3 and N, and N itself may have other factors.

Students might discuss that algebraic equations

  • are made up of expressions (so all relationships above apply); and
  • show quantities that are equal or show expressions that are equal.

Did You Know?

More than two thousand years ago, there was a Greek mathematician named Euclid. He showed that there are an infinite number of prime numbers. Since then, mathematicians have been searching for formulas that generate prime numbers.

So far, they have bee unsuccessful. For this reason, large prime numbers are used to encode top-secret information. In 1999, Nayan Hajratwala found a prime number with more than 2 million digits.

The electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF) awarded him $50,000. In 2008, a group who found a prime number with more than 12 digits won $100,000 in prize money. In October 2023, Patrick Laroche found the largest known prime number 282, 589,933 - 1. It is a number with 24,862,048 digits when written in base 10. It is also a Mersenne prime with are numbers that are one less than a power of two.

You can now win $250,000 for finding a prime number with more than 1,000,000,000 digits.
